text.section:
Sec. 1-4.2. County name change.
"Miami-Dade County" is hereby recognized as the official name of Dade County, Florida.
All references to Dade County, Metropolitan Dade County or Metro-Dade County in the Florida Constitution, Florida Statutes, Code of Metropolitan Dade County, federal law, case law, court orders, regulations, public records, official county seal and logo, tax and special assessment rolls, and any and all other documents, papers, letters, maps, plats, books, tapes, photographs, films, sound recordings, data processing software, or other material, regardless of the physical form, characteristics, or means of transmission, shall deemed to be references to Miami-Dade County. This ordinance, and this section, shall apply to all such references without regard to whether they precede, are contemporary with, or occur subsequent to the effective date of this section.
The county remains the same political subdivision of the State of Florida as previously for all purposes and retains all rights, privileges, immunities, obligations and claims thereof unaffected by the change of name.
